bug.author: janosh
bug.summary: Docs do not link to source
bug.description:
One really useful feature in the sklearn docs is that each and every item has a link back to its source on GitHub. For example, see <denchmark-link:https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.ensemble.RandomForestRegressor.html>RandomForestRegressor</denchmark-link> :
class sklearn.ensemble.RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=’warn’, criterion=’mse’, max_depth=None, min_samples_split=2, min_samples_leaf=1, min_weight_fraction_leaf=0.0, max_features=’auto’, max_leaf_nodes=None, min_impurity_decrease=0.0, min_impurity_split=None, bootstrap=True, oob_score=False, n_jobs=None, random_state=None, verbose=0, warm_start=False) --> [source] <--
Would be nice if the TF docs could do the same.

comments.comment: Every TF API is now doing that. There is a big Github button at the top :) <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/concat>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/concat</denchmark-link>
